title: app store
body:
this is an issue to get a discussion board here in the bug tracker (and don't forget about it):

as @tanghus in https://mail.kde.org/pipermail/owncloud/2013-october/010919.html wrote:

> it's no big secret that neither users nor developers are really happy with the state of apps.owncloud.org for several different reasons. ocs/opendesktop filled a gap when it was introduced, and has been very good for stuff like ghns on kde, but the api is clumsy, it doesn't allow multiple versions, the ux is - hmm, unsatisfactory - and most importantly it seems that it is no longer being actively maintained or improved.
> 
> as none of us have the time to improve it, i propose moving to a different platform. i don't wanna diz anyones brain child, but rather avoid having work time spread to thin. if we can upstream content publishing/delivery to an actively developed project, a lot of time and frustrations could be saved.
> 
> plasma active needed a content publishing platform, and decided to develop a new open platform called bodega, which seems to be just what is needed for owncloud.
> 
> i haven't studied it closely, but here are some links for anyone interested:
> 
> http://aseigo.blogspot.ch/2013/10/bodega-its-all-about-participants.html
> http://aseigo.blogspot.dk/2013/10/publishing-content-with-bodega.html
> http://zrusin.blogspot.dk/2013/10/bodega.html
> https://projects.kde.org/projects/extragear/network/bodega-server

as this is an overall issue i hope it's okay to mention all - cc @owncloud/core-developers
